sectiondef.header: MM Data Sizes for Peeks and Pokes

briefdescription.para: Used to indicate that no memtype specified.
Normal RAM, no special access required.
EEPROM, requires special access for writes.
Optional memory type that is only 8-bit read/write.
Optional memory type that is only 16-bit read/write.
Optional memory type that is only 32-bit read/write.
Used to clear out symbol name strings.
Used to clear out file name strings.
Used to clear out memory address variables.
Used to clear out fill and test patterns.
Used to clear out HK action variable.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Implements the Noop command that insures the MM task is alive

simplesect.title: Command Verification
simplesect.para:
Successful execution of this command may be verified with the following telemetry:
$sc_$cpu_MM_CMDPC - command counter will increment
The MM_NOOP_INF_EID informational event message will be generated when the command is received

simplesect.title: Error Conditions
simplesect.para:
This command may fail for the following reason(s):
Command packet length not as expected

simplesect.title: Evidence of failure may be found in the following telemetry:
Criticality
simplesect.para: None

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Resets the MM housekeeping counters

simplesect.title: Command Verification
simplesect.para:
Successful execution of this command may be verified with the following telemetry:
$sc_$cpu_MM_CMDPC - command counter will be cleared
$sc_$cpu_MM_CMDEC - command error counter will be cleared
The MM_RESET_DBG_EID informational event message will be generated when the command is executed

simplesect.title: Error Conditions
simplesect.para:
This command may fail for the following reason(s):
Command packet length not as expected

simplesect.title: Evidence of failure may be found in the following telemetry:
Criticality
simplesect.para: None

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Reads 8,16, or 32 bits of data from any given input address

detaileddescription.para:
Command Structure
MM_PeekCmd_t Command Verification
Successful execution of this command may be verified with the following telemetry:
$sc_$cpu_MM_CMDPC - command counter will increment
$sc_$cpu_MM_LastActn - will be set to MM_PEEK
$sc_$cpu_MM_MemType - will be set to the commanded memory type
$sc_$cpu_MM_Address - will be set to the fully resolved destination memory address
$sc_$cpu_MM_BytesProc - will be set to the byte size of the peek operation (1, 2, or 4)
The MM_PEEK_BYTE_INF_EID informational event message will be generated with the peek data if the data size was 8 bits
The MM_PEEK_WORD_INF_EID informational event message will be generated with the peek data if the data size was 16 bits
The MM_PEEK_DWORD_INF_EID informational event message will be generated with the peek data if the data size was 32 bits
Error Conditions
This command may fail for the following reason(s):
Command packet length not as expected
A symbol name was specified that can't be resolved
The specified data size is invalid
The specified memory type is invalid
The address range fails validation check
The address and data size are not properly aligned
Evidence of failure may be found in the following telemetry:
$sc_$cpu_MM_CMDEC - command error counter will increment
Error specific event message MM_LEN_ERR_EID
Error specific event message MM_SYMNAME_ERR_EID
Error specific event message MM_DATA_SIZE_BITS_ERR_EID
Error specific event message MM_MEMTYPE_ERR_EID
Error specific event message MM_OS_MEMVALIDATE_ERR_EID
Error specific event message MM_ALIGN16_ERR_EID
Error specific event message MM_ALIGN32_ERR_EID
Criticality
It is the responsibility of the user to verify the DestSymAddress and MemType in the command. It is possible to generate a machine check exception when accessing I/O memory addresses/registers and other types of memory. The user is cautioned to use extreme care. Note: Valid memory ranges are defined within a hardcoded structure contained in the PSP layer (CFE_PSP_MemoryTable) however, not every address within the defined ranges may be valid.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Writes 8, 16, or 32 bits of data to any memory address

detaileddescription.para:
Command Structure
MM_PokeCmd_t Command Verification
Successful execution of this command may be verified with the following telemetry:
$sc_$cpu_MM_CMDPC - command counter will increment
$sc_$cpu_MM_LastActn - will be set to MM_POKE
$sc_$cpu_MM_MemType - will be set to the commanded memory type
$sc_$cpu_MM_Address - will be set to the fully resolved source memory address
$sc_$cpu_MM_BytesProc - will be set to the byte size of the poke operation (1, 2, or 4)
The MM_POKE_BYTE_INF_EID informational event message will be generated if the data size was 8 bits
The MM_POKE_WORD_INF_EID informational event message will be generated if the data size was 16 bits
The MM_POKE_DWORD_INF_EID informational event message will be generated if the data size was 32 bits
Error Conditions
This command may fail for the following reason(s):
Command packet length not as expected
A symbol name was specified that can't be resolved
The specified data size is invalid
The specified memory type is invalid
The address range fails validation check
The address and data size are not properly aligned
An EEPROM write error occured
Evidence of failure may be found in the following telemetry:
$sc_$cpu_MM_CMDEC - command error counter will increment
Error specific event message MM_LEN_ERR_EID
Error specific event message MM_SYMNAME_ERR_EID
Error specific event message MM_DATA_SIZE_BITS_ERR_EID
Error specific event message MM_MEMTYPE_ERR_EID
Error specific event message MM_OS_MEMVALIDATE_ERR_EID
Error specific event message MM_ALIGN16_ERR_EID
Error specific event message MM_ALIGN32_ERR_EID
Error specific event message MM_OS_EEPROMWRITE8_ERR_EID
Error specific event message MM_OS_EEPROMWRITE16_ERR_EID
Error specific event message MM_OS_EEPROMWRITE32_ERR_EID
Criticality
It is the responsibility of the user to verify the DestSymAddress, MemType, and Data in the command. It is highly recommended to verify the success or failure of the memory poke. The poke may be verified by issuing a subsequent peek command and evaluating the returned value. It is possible to destroy critical information with this command causing unknown consequences. In addition, it is possible to generate a machine check exception when accessing I/O memory addresses/registers and other types of memory. The user is cautioned to use extreme care. Note: Valid memory ranges are defined within a hardcoded structure contained in the PSP layer (CFE_PSP_MemoryTable) however, not every address within the defined ranges may be valid.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Reprogram processor memory with input data. Loads up to MM_MAX_UNINTERRUPTABLE_DATA data bytes into RAM with interrupts disabled

detaileddescription.para:
Command Structure
MM_LoadMemWIDCmd_t Command Verification
Successful execution of this command may be verified with the following telemetry:
$sc_$cpu_MM_CMDPC - command counter will increment
$sc_$cpu_MM_LastActn - will be set to MM_LOAD_WID
$sc_$cpu_MM_Address - will be set to the fully resolved destination memory address
$sc_$cpu_MM_BytesProc - will be set to the number of bytes loaded
The MM_LOAD_WID_INF_EID information event message will be generated when the command is executed
Error Conditions
This command may fail for the following reason(s):
Command packet length not as expected
A symbol name was specified that can't be resolved
The computed CRC doesn't match the command message value
The address range fails validation check
Invalid data size specified in command message
Evidence of failure may be found in the following telemetry:
$sc_$cpu_MM_CMDEC - command error counter will increment
Error specific event message MM_LEN_ERR_EID
Error specific event message MM_SYMNAME_ERR_EID
Error specific event message MM_LOAD_WID_CRC_ERR_EID
Error specific event message MM_OS_MEMVALIDATE_ERR_EID
Error specific event message MM_DATA_SIZE_BYTES_ERR_EID
Criticality
It is the responsibility of the user to verify the DestSymAddress, NumOfBytes, and DataArray contents in the command. It is highly recommended to verify the success or failure of the memory load. The load may be verified by dumping memory and evaluating the dump contents. It is possible to destroy critical information with this command causing unknown consequences. In addition, it is possible to generate a machine check exception when accessing I/O memory addresses/registers and other types of memory. The user is cautioned to use extreme care. Note: Valid memory ranges are defined within a hardcoded structure contained in the PSP layer (CFE_PSP_MemoryTable) however, not every address within the defined ranges may be valid.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Reprograms processor memory with the data contained within the given input file

detaileddescription.para:
Command Structure
MM_LoadMemFromFileCmd_t Command Verification
Successful execution of this command may be verified with the following telemetry:
$sc_$cpu_MM_CMDPC - command counter will increment
$sc_$cpu_MM_LastActn - will be set to MM_LOAD_FROM_FILE
$sc_$cpu_MM_MemType - will be set to the commanded memory type
$sc_$cpu_MM_Address - will be set to the fully resolved destination memory address
$sc_$cpu_MM_BytesProc - will be set to the number of bytes loaded
$sc_$cpu_MM_LastFile[OS_MAX_PATH_LEN] - will be set to the load file name
The MM_LD_MEM_FILE_INF_EID informational event message will be generated
Error Conditions
This command may fail for the following reason(s):
Command packet length not as expected
Command specified filename is invalid
OS_open call fails
OS_close call fails
OS_read doesn't read the expected number of bytes
The #CFS_ComputeCRCFromFile call fails
The computed CRC doesn't match the load file value
A symbol name was specified that can't be resolved
CFE_FS_ReadHeader call fails
OS_read call fails
The address range fails validation check
The specified data size is invalid
The address and data size are not properly aligned
The specified memory type is invalid
Evidence of failure may be found in the following telemetry:
$sc_$cpu_MM_CMDEC - command error counter will increment
Error specific event message MM_LEN_ERR_EID
Error specific event message MM_CMD_FNAME_ERR_EID
Error specific event message MM_OS_OPEN_ERR_EID
Error specific event message MM_OS_CLOSE_ERR_EID
Error specific event message MM_OS_READ_EXP_ERR_EID
Error specific event message MM_CFS_COMPUTECRCFROMFILE_ERR_EID
Error specific event message MM_LOAD_FILE_CRC_ERR_EID
Error specific event message MM_SYMNAME_ERR_EID
Error specific event message MM_FILE_LOAD_PARAMS_ERR_EID
Error specific event message MM_CFE_FS_READHDR_ERR_EID
Error specific event message MM_OS_READ_ERR_EID
Error specific event message MM_OS_MEMVALIDATE_ERR_EID
Error specific event message MM_DATA_SIZE_BYTES_ERR_EID
Error specific event message MM_ALIGN32_ERR_EID
Error specific event message MM_ALIGN16_ERR_EID
Error specific event message MM_MEMTYPE_ERR_EID
Criticality
It is the responsibility of the user to verify the contents of the load file in the command. It is highly recommended to verify the success or failure of the memory load. The load may be verified by dumping memory and evaluating the dump contents. It is possible to destroy critical information with this command causing unknown consequences. In addition, it is possible to generate a machine check exception when accessing I/O memory addresses/registers and other types of memory. The user is cautioned to use extreme care. Note: Valid memory ranges are defined within a hardcoded structure contained in the PSP layer (CFE_PSP_MemoryTable) however, not every address within the defined ranges may be valid.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Dumps the input number of bytes from processor memory to a file

detaileddescription.para:
Command Structure
MM_DumpMemToFileCmd_t Command Verification
Successful execution of this command may be verified with the following telemetry:
$sc_$cpu_MM_CMDPC - command counter will increment
$sc_$cpu_MM_LastActn - will be set to MM_DUMP_TO_FILE
$sc_$cpu_MM_MemType - will be set to the commanded memory type
$sc_$cpu_MM_Address - will be set to the fully resolved source memory address
$sc_$cpu_MM_BytesProc - will be set to the number of bytes dumped
$sc_$cpu_MM_LastFile[OS_MAX_PATH_LEN] - will be set to the dump file name
The MM_DMP_MEM_FILE_INF_EID informational event message will be generated
Error Conditions
This command may fail for the following reason(s):
Command packet length not as expected
Command specified filename is invalid
A symbol name was specified that can't be resolved
OS_creat call fails
CFE_FS_WriteHeader call fails
OS_close call fails
OS_write doesn't write the expected number of bytes or returns an error code
The #CFS_ComputeCRCFromFile call fails
The address range fails validation check
The specified data size is invalid
The address and data size are not properly aligned
The specified memory type is invalid
Evidence of failure may be found in the following telemetry:
$sc_$cpu_MM_CMDEC - command error counter will increment
Error specific event message MM_LEN_ERR_EID
Error specific event message MM_CMD_FNAME_ERR_EID
Error specific event message MM_SYMNAME_ERR_EID
Error specific event message MM_OS_CREAT_ERR_EID
Error specific event message MM_CFE_FS_WRITEHDR_ERR_EID
Error specific event message MM_OS_CLOSE_ERR_EID
Error specific event message MM_OS_WRITE_EXP_ERR_EID
Error specific event message MM_CFS_COMPUTECRCFROMFILE_ERR_EID
Error specific event message MM_OS_MEMVALIDATE_ERR_EID
Error specific event message MM_DATA_SIZE_BYTES_ERR_EID
Error specific event message MM_ALIGN32_ERR_EID
Error specific event message MM_ALIGN16_ERR_EID
Error specific event message MM_MEMTYPE_ERR_EID
Criticality
It is the responsibility of the user to verify the SrcSymAddress, NumOfBytes, and MemType in the command. It is possible to generate a machine check exception when accessing I/O memory addresses/registers and other types of memory. The user is cautioned to use extreme care. Note: Valid memory ranges are defined within a hardcoded structure contained in the PSP layer (CFE_PSP_MemoryTable) however, not every address within the defined ranges may be valid.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Dumps up to #MM_MAX_DUMP_INEVENT_BYTES of memory in an event message

detaileddescription.para:
Command Structure
MM_DumpInEventCmd_t Command Verification
Successful execution of this command may be verified with the following telemetry:
$sc_$cpu_MM_CMDPC - command counter will increment
$sc_$cpu_MM_LastActn - will be set to MM_DUMP_INEVENT
$sc_$cpu_MM_MemType - will be set to the commanded memory type
$sc_$cpu_MM_Address - will be set to the fully resolved source memory address
$sc_$cpu_MM_BytesProc - will be set to the number of bytes dumped
The MM_DUMP_INEVENT_INF_EID informational event message will be generated with the dump data
Error Conditions
This command may fail for the following reason(s):
Command packet length not as expected
A symbol name was specified that can't be resolved
The address range fails validation check
The specified data size is invalid
The address and data size are not properly aligned
The specified memory type is invalid
Evidence of failure may be found in the following telemetry:
$sc_$cpu_MM_CMDEC - command error counter will increment
Error specific event message MM_LEN_ERR_EID
Error specific event message MM_SYMNAME_ERR_EID
Error specific event message MM_OS_MEMVALIDATE_ERR_EID
Error specific event message MM_DATA_SIZE_BYTES_ERR_EID
Error specific event message MM_ALIGN32_ERR_EID
Error specific event message MM_ALIGN16_ERR_EID
Error specific event message MM_MEMTYPE_ERR_EID
Criticality
It is the responsibility of the user to verify the SrcSymAddress, NumOfBytes, and MemType in the command. It is possible to generate a machine check exception when accessing I/O memory addresses/registers and other types of memory. The user is cautioned to use extreme care. Note: Valid memory ranges are defined within a hardcoded structure contained in the PSP layer (CFE_PSP_MemoryTable) however, not every address within the defined ranges may be valid.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Reprograms processor memory with the fill pattern contained within the command message

detaileddescription.para:
Command Structure
MM_FillMemCmd_t Command Verification
Successful execution of this command may be verified with the following telemetry:
$sc_$cpu_MM_CMDPC - command counter will increment
$sc_$cpu_MM_LastActn - will be set to MM_FILL
$sc_$cpu_MM_MemType - will be set to the commanded memory type
$sc_$cpu_MM_Address - will be set to the fully resolved destination memory address
MM_FILLPATTERN - will be set to the fill pattern used
$sc_$cpu_MM_BytesProc - will be set to the number of bytes filled
The MM_FILL_INF_EID informational event message will be generated when the command is executed
Error Conditions
This command may fail for the following reason(s):
Command packet length not as expected
A symbol name was specified that can't be resolved
The address range fails validation check
The specified data size is invalid
The address and data size are not properly aligned
The specified memory type is invalid
Evidence of failure may be found in the following telemetry:
$sc_$cpu_MM_CMDEC - command error counter will increment
Error specific event message MM_LEN_ERR_EID
Error specific event message MM_SYMNAME_ERR_EID
Error specific event message MM_OS_MEMVALIDATE_ERR_EID
Error specific event message MM_DATA_SIZE_BYTES_ERR_EID
Error specific event message MM_ALIGN32_ERR_EID
Error specific event message MM_ALIGN16_ERR_EID
Error specific event message MM_MEMTYPE_ERR_EID
Criticality
It is the responsibility of the user to verify the DestSymAddress, and NumOfBytes in the command. It is highly recommended to verify the success or failure of the memory fill. The fill may be verified by dumping memory and evaluating the dump contents. It is possible to destroy critical information with this command causing unknown consequences. In addition, it is possible to generate a machine check exception when accessing I/O memory addresses/registers and other types of memory. The user is cautioned to use extreme care. Note: Valid memory ranges are defined within a hardcoded structure contained in the PSP layer (CFE_PSP_MemoryTable) however, not every address within the defined ranges may be valid.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Queries the system symbol table and reports the resolved address in telemetry and an informational event message

simplesect.title: Command Verification
simplesect.para:
Successful execution of this command may be verified with the following telemetry:
$sc_$cpu_MM_CMDPC - command counter will increment
$sc_$cpu_MM_LastActn - will be set to MM_SYM_LOOKUP
$sc_$cpu_MM_Address - will be set to the fully resolved memory address

simplesect.title: Error Conditions
simplesect.para:
This command may fail for the following reason(s):
Command packet length not as expected
An empty string was specified as the symbol name
A symbol name was specified that can't be resolved

simplesect.title: Evidence of failure may be found in the following telemetry:
Criticality
simplesect.para: None

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Saves the system symbol table to a file that can be transfered to the ground

simplesect.title: Command Verification
simplesect.para:
Successful execution of this command may be verified with the following telemetry:
$sc_$cpu_MM_CMDPC - command counter will increment
$sc_$cpu_MM_LastActn - will be set to MM_SYMTBL_SAVE
$sc_$cpu_MM_LastFile[OS_MAX_PATH_LEN] - will be set to the dump file name
The MM_SYMTBL_TO_FILE_INF_EID informational event message will be generated when the command is executed

simplesect.title: Error Conditions
simplesect.para:
This command may fail for the following reason(s):
Command packet length not as expected
An empty string was specified as the dump filename
The OSAL returns a status other than success to the command

simplesect.title: Evidence of failure may be found in the following telemetry:

listitem.para: Dump filenames #OS_MAX_PATH_LEN characters or longer are truncated

simplesect.title: Criticality
simplesect.para: None

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Enables writing to a specified EEPROM bank

simplesect.title: Command Verification
simplesect.para:
Successful execution of this command may be verified with the following telemetry:
$sc_$cpu_MM_CMDPC - command counter will increment
$sc_$cpu_MM_LastActn - will be set to MM_EEPROMWRITE_ENA
The MM_EEPROM_WRITE_ENA_INF_EID informational event message will be generated when the command is executed

simplesect.title: Error Conditions
simplesect.para:
This command may fail for the following reason(s):
Command packet length not as expected
Non-success return status from PSP write enable

simplesect.title: Evidence of failure may be found in the following telemetry:
Criticality
simplesect.para: Extreme caution is advised in the use of this command. It is intended to be used only as a maintence tool for patching the default FSW image. This command will leave the EEPROM bank in a very vulnerable state. Once a patch has been completed the MM_DISABLE_EEPROM_WRITE_CC command must be issued to protect the EEPROM bank from being inadvertently written.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Disables writing to a specified EEPROM bank

simplesect.title: Command Verification
simplesect.para:
Successful execution of this command may be verified with the following telemetry:
$sc_$cpu_MM_CMDPC - command counter will increment
$sc_$cpu_MM_LastActn - will be set to MM_EEPROMWRITE_DIS
The MM_EEPROM_WRITE_DIS_INF_EID informational event message will be generated when the command is executed

simplesect.title: Error Conditions
simplesect.para:
This command may fail for the following reason(s):
Command packet length not as expected
Non-success return status from PSP write disable

simplesect.title: Evidence of failure may be found in the following telemetry:
Criticality
simplesect.para: None
